dc:title: Poverty and Precarity
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: An essay on the mystery and complexity of poverty, real and voluntary kinds. Enumerates the many forms of poverty, the irony of "poverty" in "rich" religious orders, and finally poverty as a means of helping the poor.
